text.0: thou soma dweller on the hills effused hast flowed into the sieve.
text.2: thou art a sacred bard a sage the meath is offipring of thy sap.
text.4: all deities of one accord have come that they may drink of thee.
text.6: he who containeth in his hands all treasures much to be desired.
text.8: who milketh out this mighty pair the earth and heaven like mother kine.
text.10: who in a moment mightily floweth around these two worldhalvcs.
text.12: the strong one being purified hath in the pitchers cried aloud.
